article.headline: Mercer 82, Lipscomb 73
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Wesley Duke scored 18 points to lead Mercer to a 82-73 victory over Lipscomb on Monday night. The Bisons (8-4, 3-2 Atlantic Sun) lost a 50-43 halftime lead. James Poindexter scored 28 points and Brian Fisk added 13 points for Lipscomb, but it wasn't enough to hold off the Bears (8-4, 4-2). Lipscomb lost momentum after Mercer's Tyler McCurry hit a 3-pointer, his only basket, to put the Bears up 72-71 with five minutes left in the game. Mercer never trailed after McCurry's shot. Jacob Skogen added 12 points, Damitrius Coleman 11 and Will Emerson had 10 points and nine rebounds. Lipscomb scored 30 of its first 32 points in the game on 3-pointers, led by Poindexter, who was 6-for-9 in the half. But Mercer shot 63 percent from the field in the first 20 minutes to stay close. The Bisons went cold in the second half, shooting just 14.3 percent from long range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
